conversation.content: J'ai essayé d'être patient avec ça mais, [frustrated], je me suis fait avertir au travail aujourd'hui parce que, [trembling], je me suis endormi pendant une présentation client après, [exhausted], encore une de tes répétitions toute la nuit en haut, tu vois.
Écoute, je paie mon loyer comme, [defensive], tout le monde et cet immeuble n'a pas, [dismissive], d'heures de silence après 22h. [shrugs]
[angry] Alors, euh, ça rend correct de, [bitter], piétiner jusqu'à 3h du matin quand tu sais, ben, que les gens essaient de dormir en dessous? [laughs bitterly]
[cold] Mon bail de studio me permet spécifiquement de, [firm], pratiquer mon art whenever I need to prepare for performances.
Ton art est en train de ruiner ma vie et je veux dire, [breaking], I could lose my job if I get another warning, tu sais?
[unmoved] Ben, peut-être que tu devrais, euh, consider finding a job qui ne, [condescending], demande pas d'être si, [mocking], délicat avec ton sommeil de beauté, je veux dire. [scoffs]

J'habite ici depuis, euh, 5 ans et j'ai jamais eu de, [hurt], problèmes jusqu'à ce que tu déménages il y a 6 mois et que tu transformes cet, [angry], endroit en ta piste de danse personnelle à, [shouting], toute heure comme si le reste d'entre nous n'existait pas, ben.
[harsh] Euh, on dirait que t'es, [cruel], jaloux que quelqu'un ait vraiment de la passion pour ce qu'il fait, tu sais?
[stunned] Wow, c'est vraiment ce que tu, [disgusted], penses que c'est à propos de ça quand je suis littéralement, euh, en train de te supplier de juste, ben, montrer une décence humaine de base?
[cutting] Ben, euh, ouais.
Tu sais quoi, j'ai, euh, déjà commencé à documenter chaque, [determined], dérangement avec les heures et les enregistrements, je veux dire.
[threatening] Vas-y, essaie de, [sneering], faire quelque chose avec ça, euh, but we both know how this ends, tu sais. [laughs coldly]

Les autres locataires sont, euh, tannés aussi et on va tous, [resolved], filing complaints together parce que t'as réussi à, [bitter], aliéner littéralement tout le monde dans cet immeuble avec ton, [disgusted], manque total de considération, ben, pour n'importe qui sauf toi-même, euh.
[icy] Ben, je vais nulle part alors tu devrais probablement, [dismissive], start looking for a new place, je veux dire, si tu peux pas gérer la vie en ville. [pauses]
[quiet] C'est pas la vie en ville, c'est juste, [sad], toi qui es une personne horrible, [defeated]. [sighs heavily]
[indifferent] Euh, appelle-moi ce qui te fait, [bored], sentir mieux à propos de ta vie pathétique mais j'ai, [final], une répétition dans une heure alors, ben, tu sais. [footsteps leaving]
[resigned] Bon, alors le propriétaire peut, [weary], deal with this when half the building breaks their leases.

[laughing] Le propriétaire est mon oncle qui, [smug], owns four buildings on this block et, [triumphant], m'a donné cet appartement spécifiquement pour que je puisse, [proud], pratiquer quand je veux. [door slams]
[hollow] Bien sûr qu'il l'est, because nothing in my life, [broken], peut juste être simple ou, [trembling], juste, n'est-ce pas? [voice cracks]
Peut-être que maintenant tu vas enfin, [victorious], comprendre ta place ici.

original_conversation.content: I've been, um, trying to be patient about this but, [frustrated], I got written up at work today because, [trembling], I fell asleep during a client presentation after, [exhausted], another one of your, uh, all-night rehearsal sessions upstairs, I mean.
Look, I pay my rent just, [defensive], like you do and this building doesn't have, [dismissive], quiet hours after ten PM. [shrugs]
[angry] So, um, that makes it okay to, [bitter], stomp around until three AM when you know, well, people are trying to sleep below you? [laughs bitterly]
[cold] My studio lease specifically allows me to, [firm], practice my craft whenever I need to prepare for performances.
Your craft is, um, ruining my life and I mean, [breaking], I could lose my job if I get another warning, you know?
[unmoved] Well, maybe you should, um, consider finding a job that doesn't, [condescending], require you to be so, [mocking], delicate about your beauty sleep, I mean. [scoffs]

I've lived here for, uh, five years and never had, [hurt], problems until you moved in six months ago and turned this, [angry], place into your personal dance floor at, [shouting], all hours like the rest of us don't, well, exist.
[harsh] Um, sounds like you're, [cruel], jealous that someone actually has passion for what they do, you know?
[stunned] Wow, that's really what you, [disgusted], think this is about when I'm literally, um, begging you to just, well, show basic human decency?
[cutting] Well, um, yeah.
You know what, I've, um, already started documenting every single, [determined], disturbance with timestamps and recordings, I mean.
[threatening] Go ahead and try to, [sneering], make something of it, um, but we both know how this ends, you know. [laughs coldly]

The other tenants are, uh, fed up too and we're all, [resolved], filing complaints together because you've managed to, [bitter], alienate literally everyone in this building with your, [disgusted], complete lack of consideration, well, for anyone but yourself, um.
[icy] Well, I'm not going anywhere so you should probably, [dismissive], start looking for a new place, I mean, if you can't handle city living. [pauses]
[quiet] This isn't city living, it's just, [sad], you being an awful, [defeated], person. [sighs heavily]
[indifferent] Um, call me whatever makes you feel, [bored], better about your pathetic life but I have, [final], rehearsal in an hour so, well, you know. [footsteps leaving]
[resigned] Fine, then the landlord can, [weary], deal with this when half the building breaks their leases.
[laughing] The landlord is my uncle who, [smug], owns four buildings on this block and, [triumphant], gave me this unit specifically so I could, [proud], practice whenever I want. [door slams]
[hollow] Of course he is, because nothing in my life, [broken], can ever just be simple or, [trembling], fair anymore, can it? [voice cracks]
Maybe now you'll finally, [victorious], understand your place here.

scenario: A renter confronts their upstairs neighbor, a dance instructor, after months of loud practice sessions have caused them to receive a performance warning at their work-from-home job.
